pr_title: Add more traces for state-lock management

timeline.message: Add more traces for state-lock management

timeline.bodyText: do you also want thread name, or just the id? Also, I think for logging you need "{}", not "%d". "%d" I think is for String.format().
timeline.author: gpang

timeline.bodyText: why is the other one guarded by LOG.isDebugEnabled()?
timeline.author: gpang

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this syntax is correct. It doesn't have enough arguments, and is "%ms" correct?
timeline.author: gpang

timeline.bodyText: Could this be useful for INFO level?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: Right. I now made many of them as INFO.
replies.author: ggezer

timeline.bodyText: Could it be useful to log something here at INFO, since we were not able to get the lock?
timeline.author: gpang

timeline.bodyText: this may not be accurate, since the real interrupt happens in the loop below.
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: Bumped it down for consistent logging.
replies.author: ggezer

timeline.bodyText: I think that we might want to wrap this in a if (Log.isDebugEnabled()) because grabbing iterating, and joining into a String can be pretty expensive?
timeline.author: ZacBlanco

replies.bodyText: I made it INFO now. We don't want to miss this trace when it happens.
replies.author: ggezer

replies.bodyText: How often do we expect this method to run?
replies.author: ZacBlanco

replies.bodyText: every 30secs by default only if it is activated under certain conditions.
replies.author: ggezer

replies.bodyText: ok, I think it's fine then. I just wanted to make sure it doesn't need to get computed frequently.
replies.author: ZacBlanco

timeline.bodyText: I think that we might want to wrap this in a if (Log.isDebugEnabled()) because grabbing iterating, and joining into a String can be pretty expensive?
timeline.author: ZacBlanco

replies.bodyText: I made it INFO now. This is OK to be seen imo.
replies.author: ggezer

timeline.author: gpang

timeline.bodyText: This will print every 10 minutes for 12 hours? Is that too noisy?
timeline.author: gpang

timeline.bodyText: Hrmmm, is this right? I thought TIMEOUT mode would not force the lock by interrupting threads?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: no we have to interrupt during the lock. not just when forcing the lock.
replies.author: ggezer

replies.bodyText:
If the lock is acquired by the grace-cycle, we still need to run the interrupt-cycle for maintaining the heart-beats.
TIMEOUT and FORCED make sense when the lock was not grabbed by the grace-cycle. In this context FORCED would mean to activate the interrupt-cycle before taking the lock.
replies.author: ggezer
